techmeme.title: Microsoft and a16z jointly share US public policy ideas for AI startups, saying "regulation should be implemented only if its benefits outweigh its costs" (Microsoft)
Nvidia will replace Intel in the Dow Jones Industrial Average on November 8, after Amazon replaced Walgreens in February; Intel joined the index in 1999 (Bloomberg)
Polymarket user Fredi9999, a self-described Frenchman, says he bet $30M+ on Trump after analyzing polls; he can't exit his wagers without crashing the market (Alexander Osipovich/Wall Street Journal)
Google researchers detail Project Big Sleep, formerly Project Naptime, which used an AI agent to discover a previously unknown and exploitable bug in SQLite (Michael Kan/PCMag)
CoreWeave told investors its signed contracts are worth $17B, including $10B by Microsoft from 2023 to 2030, and it expects revenue to grow 4x to $8B in 2025 (The Information)
